channel.title: Post your whip (car)
channel.description:
Been almost a year since I updated this got rid of my blazer s10 before I moved to Colorado in December 2012.
My new car: 2007 mazda 6 [img width=1000]http://imageshack.us/a/img802/5744/8an5.jpg[/img] [img width=1000]http://imageshack.us/a/img20/8080/b0sb.jpg[/img]
Post yours.

item.title: Post your whip (car)
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:495, topic:455606”][quote author=nolan2131 link=topic=558513.msg4498011#msg4498011 date=1446138622]

[quote author=Travas link=topic=558513.msg4497919#msg4497919 date=1446005044]

nice, how many miles?

Ty, 140k, super clean.
[/quote]how much did you pay for it? what year is it? can’t say i like the rims on it but eh, a vett is a vett.

I paid 12.5k, books 15.6, it’s a 2002, and the rims are actually 2008 C6 Z06 rims, I would be opposed to them otherwise, but they’re still corvette rims.
[/quote]man the best rims ever were the old knock off rims[/quote]

I agree, if I can snatch some up for winter to get these away from salt, I will in a heart beat. Finding them is the issue…

Read full topic

item.title: Post your whip (car)
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I absolutely hate light covers and people who black them out completely with dip and other cheap hacks. I’ve locked up my brakes several times following a friend of mine with plastishitted taillights because you just can’t see the light through the opaque color.

I personally don’t go cheap with the lighting, I’ve installed lightbars, offroad lighting, HID’s, and other lighting accessories for myself and friends, can’t tell you how much eBay shit I’ve hooked up without prior testing and the hotwire just starts to melt because of the cheap garbage that is is…

One thing I would suggest is combining the two seen above. With it being a 2015 aftermarket lighting isn’t too easy to find, but the top picture is OEM lighting with the black trim, and the bottom picture I found is something cool, it’s a laminate film you can put over your headlights. (http://www.lamin-x.com/Dodge-Dart-13-Headlight-Covers-p/d026.htm) You could try that out, since it’s easy to just peel right back off. Or spray a VERY light coat of shittydip or something like it over it just to give a slight tint to it. Throw some 35W 10000k HID’s in there and it’ll look good.

Read full topic

item.title: Post your whip (car)
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

no idea what type of lights they are lol. don’t know jack shit what I’m doing. it’s stock lights and cole told me to use nightshades on the inside of the light coverings.

not sure if there’s better or more appropriate ways, but I want the same look on the tail lights as he as, and preferably the front as well.

so they all appear black unless the lights are on. (front running lights are yellow and never turn off - I know there’s laws on the light colors. do my running lights have to stay yellow or could I change them?) my actual head lamps come on only if I switch them on or my wipers are on, and my fog lights come on if the head lamps are on and the brights aren’t. if brights are on, fog lights are off.

car is 2015 Dodge Dart if anyone was wondering, or if it helps you understand what I am talking about

Read full topic

item.title: Post your whip (car)
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

from what I understand cops will pull me over if I drive with any color underglow on, but I see it very common out by our mall, so I may test it. I know I cannot do red or blue unless at a complete park and not in the car, basically only at meets.

enterior came with stock red led strip around the entire dash, so I’ll either match it with the underglow or try to find a different color from the manufacturer.

all my bulbs are stock, as I just bought the car last month. and I’m not currently planning to buy new bulbs but just fog the covers.

Read full topic

item.title: Post your whip (car)
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:481, topic:455606”]i live in ga, usa.

anyone to provide me laws regarding window tint / exterior light colors (would like to murder my head/taillights if possible.)

currently the entire car is black w black rims, and windows / sunroof is stock tint which isn’t much. going to go the darkest possible. not sure about the reflectiveness. i want them all to be the darkest, whether its reflective or not.

as for my light, i have ordered led kits for underbody led glow, as well as interior under dash / trunk glow kits.[/quote]
Most reflective tint is illegal just about anywhere, and the legal limit is 32% all the way around except for the front windshield, which allows no tint except for the top strip. (http://tintlaws.com/georgia-window-tint-law.php) No more than 20% reflective on the sides. Afaik smoked headlight’s aren’t a problem, however you might get fuzz if you black out your tail lights, I’d just go with some smoked led assemblies. I’m running 8000k 55W HID’s and I’ve ran through GA before and never had any issues with that either.

As far as underglow goes, you can get pulled over for blue underglow, especially if it’s pointed outwards. The law is you’re not supposed to run red or blue lights that point outward. My headlights are blue/white and I haven’t gotten in any trouble with them.

http://www.ddmtuning.com/Products/DDM-HID-Kit-Slim-Ballast-35W-or-55W

Here’s a picture of the 15% tint, the back windows have that silverish factory tint inlayed in the glass so it’s a bit darker by default in the back.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

i live in ga, usa.

anyone to provide me laws regarding window tint / exterior light colors (would like to murder my head/taillights if possible.)

currently the entire car is black w black rims, and windows / sunroof is stock tint which isn’t much. going to go the darkest possible. not sure about the reflectiveness. i want them all to be the darkest, whether its reflective or not.

as for my light, i have ordered led kits for underbody led glow, as well as interior under dash / trunk glow kits.

Read full topic

item.title: Post your whip (car)
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Vain_:

I’m bout to murder my windows and lights as soon as I find all the laws and shit to it to make sure I don’t fudge myself

http://www.liftlaws.com/
Mostly for trucks but some good information in here (assuming you live in the USA which I assume so because brits don’t do cool stuff to their vehicles like that)

Tint is typically around 20%-35% on the front side windows in states that allow it at all. I’ve got 15% all the way around on mine (legal limit is 23% iirc) and I haven’t been bothered, even been ticked for speeding and such and no cops have said anything about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Post your whip (car)
item.dc:creator: @Mikeyzzz Mikeyzzz
item.description:
@Mikeyzzz wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:464, topic:455606”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=558513.msg4479670#msg4479670 date=1428717253]

Let’s get started on Exhausts and mufflers! While we’re at it, engine or motor, or better yet, gas or accelerator.

Throttle
[/quote]
Ambokile omg please stop you have no idea what you’re on about.

Exhaust and mufflers don’t even correspond like that, a muffler is a part of an exhaust system.

Motor’s and engines, lets let MIT explain this: http://engineering.mit.edu/ask/what’s-difference-between-motor-and-engine

Gas, accelerator, or throttle. Lets look at these three, the main phrase you’d hear that using the word ‘gas’ is “Give it some gas” which does not mean “give it pedal” it’s supposed to stand for you pressing the accelerator, engaging the throttle cable (carburetors and throttle bodies), pushing gas through the injectors or carburetor, and passing through a valve into the cylinder creating combustion. A throttle is a system that acts on a cable to trigger flow.[/quote]I knew all of the above, besides the engine and motor thing, but I said the others as a troll response, some arrogance and ignorance, that’s all.

Read full topic
